contentrichtext.text: In [[mathematics]], the '''bimonster''' is a [[group (mathematics)|group]] that is the [[wreath product]] of the [[monster group]] ''M'' with '''Z'''<sub>2</sub>: :<math>Bi = M \wr \mathbb{Z}_2. \, </math> The Bimonster is also a quotient of the [[Coxeter group]] corresponding to the [[Dynkin diagram]] ''Y''<sub>555</sub>, a Y-shaped [[graph theory|graph]] with 16 nodes: : {{Dynkin|nodes|3s|nodes|3s|nodes|3s|nodes|3s|branch1|node|3|node|3|node|3|node|3|node|3|node}} [[John H. Conway]] [[conjecture]]d that a [[Presentation of a group|presentation]] of the bimonster could be given by adding a certain extra relation to the presentation defined by the ''Y''<sub>555</sub> diagram; this was proved in 1990 by [[A. A. Ivanov]] and [[Simon P. Norton]]. == See also == * [[Triality]] - [[simple Lie group]] D<sub>4</sub>, ''Y''<sub>111</sub> == External links == * {{MathWorld | urlname=Bimonster | title=Bimonster}} (''Note: incorrectly named here as [3<sup>6,6,6</sup>]'') [[Category:Group theory]] {{Abstract-algebra-stub}}
